key_points: Tom Brady threw the Lombardi Trophy from his boat to another during the Buccaneers' victory parade, a move he described as impulsive and 'really fun to do'.
Brady admitted to not considering the potential disaster of dropping the trophy, which could have sunk to the bottom of the Hillsborough River.
The trophy was successfully caught by tight end Cam Brate, avoiding the catastrophe of losing it.
Brady joked about the sharp edges of the Lombardi Trophy and the risk involved in his action.
Brady's 8-year-old daughter, Vivi, was the only one who vocally objected to the toss, displaying concern for the potential loss.
Tom Brady reflected on the meaningfulness of material items and the replaceability of such, despite the risky nature of the toss.
After winning the Super Bowl, Brady's wife, Gisele, hinted at retirement by asking him what more he had to prove.
Brady has won more Super Bowls than any other player in NFL history and is considered by many as the greatest quarterback to ever play.
Despite suggestions and hints at retirement, Brady expressed his reluctance to stop playing, likening playing football to running on a treadmill he doesn't want to stop.
Brady's recount of the Lombardi Trophy toss and his reflections on his career were shared during an appearance on The Late Late Show with James Corden.
spokespersons: Tom Brady (Quarterback, appeared on The Late Late Show)
